title: Respect .gitignore and .ignore files
description: Automatically exclude files matching patterns in .gitignore, .ignore, and similar files when watching directories. Use the ignore crate for gitignore-style pattern matching. Inspired by watchexec.

title: Environment variables from dotenv files
description: Load environment variables from .env files for command execution. Support multiple dotenv files and per-handler env file configuration. Inspired by go-task dotenv support.

title: Clear terminal before command execution
description: Add option to clear terminal/screen before each command execution. Useful for development workflows where you want clean output. Inspired by watchexec --clear flag.

title: Security enhancements
description: Add handler authentication and authorization, encrypted configuration, audit logging, and secret management integration.

title: Configurable event debouncing
description: Add configurable debounce duration for filesystem events to prevent excessive command executions when files change rapidly. Default to sensible value (e.g., 100ms) with per-handler override. Inspired by watchexec.

title: Webhook trigger rules and conditions
description: Add support for trigger rules that must be satisfied before a webhook executes its command. Inspired by adnanh/webhook. Features: match rules for headers/payload/query params, AND/OR/NOT logic for combining rules, regex and exact match support.

title: Integration ecosystem
description: Create Terraform provider, Kubernetes operator, GitHub Actions, and CI/CD integrations.

title: Configurable shell for command execution
description: Allow configuring which shell to use for command execution (bash, zsh, sh, powershell, cmd). Support per-handler shell override. Default to $SHELL or sh. Inspired by watchexec --shell option.

title: Advanced logging and tracing
description: Add structured logging with trace IDs, OpenTelemetry support, and log aggregation endpoints.

title: Path substitution in commands
description: Replace placeholders in commands with event-specific data. For filesystem: $FILE, $DIR, $EVENT. For webhooks: $METHOD, $PATH. Similar to entr's /_ substitution and watchexec's {{path}}.

title: Event forwarding between handlers
description: Enable handlers to trigger other handlers directly without shell commands. Requires: Handler ID system, internal event bus, event data passing between handlers.

title: Retry logic with exponential backoff
description: Add retry logic with exponential backoff for command execution failures. Part of Phase 1 core stability.

title: Webhook HMAC signature verification
description: Add HMAC signature verification for webhook payloads to ensure requests come from trusted sources. Support HMAC-SHA1, HMAC-SHA256, and HMAC-SHA512. Inspired by adnanh/webhook and GitHub webhook signatures.

title: Testing framework
description: Add YAML-based test definitions for handlers with input/output expectations, exit code validation, and output matching.

title: JSON configuration format support
description: Support JSON as an alternative to YAML for configuration files. Auto-detect format based on file extension or content. Inspired by adnanh/webhook which supports both.

title: Postpone first execution option
description: Add option to skip immediate execution and wait for first event before running command. Currently cron waits but filesystem/webhook execute immediately on matching events. Inspired by watchexec --postpone and entr -p.

title: Include/import other config files
description: Support including other YAML files into main config for better organization. Allow splitting handlers across multiple files with namespacing. Inspired by go-task includes feature.

title: Binary releases for major platforms
description: Create binary releases for Linux, macOS, and Windows. Part of Phase 1 core stability.

title: Webhook response customization
description: Include command output in webhook HTTP response body. Set HTTP status code based on command exit code (200 for success, 500 for failure). Add configurable response headers. Inspired by adnanh/webhook.

title: Pass request data to webhook commands
description: Pass HTTP request data (headers, body, query parameters) to webhook commands as environment variables or command arguments. Support JSON payload parsing and field extraction. Inspired by adnanh/webhook.

title: Webhook IP whitelisting
description: Add IP whitelist/allowlist support for webhook handlers to restrict which IPs can trigger webhooks. Support CIDR notation and multiple IP ranges. Inspired by adnanh/webhook.

title: Manual trigger support
description: Add ability to manually trigger handlers via keyboard input (like entr's spacebar) or HTTP endpoint. Useful for testing and debugging handlers without waiting for events.

title: File extension and glob pattern filtering
description: Add support for filtering watched files by extension (e.g., 'rs,toml,json') and glob patterns (e.g., '**/*.rs'). Allow both include and exclude patterns. Inspired by watchexec.

title: Sentry integration for error tracking
description: Integrate with Sentry for real-time error tracking and reporting of command failures. Support DSN configuration, environment tags, and release tracking. Inspired by supercronic's Sentry integration.

title: Working directory for command execution
description: Add 'dir' or 'cwd' option to specify working directory for command execution. Allow per-handler directory configuration. Inspired by go-task dir attribute.

title: High availability
description: Add handler state replication, automatic failover, and load balancing for webhooks.

title: Configuration validation mode
description: Add --test or --validate flag to verify configuration syntax and semantics without starting handlers. Report all errors and warnings. Inspired by supercronic -test flag.

title: Conditional execution based on command results
description: Execute different commands based on previous command results. Requires: Exit code tracking, conditional configuration parsing, state management for retries.

title: Event filtering and routing
description: Route events to different commands based on patterns. Requires: Pattern matching engine, variable substitution ($FILE, $EVENT, etc.), action types (execute, ignore, forward).

title: Comprehensive test coverage
description: Add comprehensive test coverage for all handlers and core functionality. Part of Phase 1 core stability.

title: Handler dependencies
description: Ensure handlers execute in specific order or wait for others. Requires: Dependency graph resolution, handler state tracking, deadlock prevention.

title: Signal handling for long-running commands
description: Send configurable signals (SIGTERM, SIGINT, SIGKILL) to running commands before re-execution or on handler shutdown. Support graceful process termination with configurable grace period. Inspired by watchexec --signal.

title: Distributed mode
description: Run handlers across multiple machines with coordination. Support Redis coordinator, node IDs, and leader election for distributed jobs.

title: List handlers command
description: Add --list flag to display all configured handlers with their types, names, and status. Similar to 'task --list' in go-task. Useful for understanding what a config file contains.

title: Hot reload configuration on signal or file change
description: Reload configuration file when receiving SIGHUP/SIGUSR2 or when the config file changes (via inotify). Allow adding/removing/modifying handlers without restart. Inspired by supercronic.

title: Non-recursive directory watching option
description: Add option to watch directories non-recursively (only direct children, not subdirectories). Currently all filesystem watching is recursive. Inspired by watchexec.

title: Handler plugins
description: Support custom handler types via plugins. Enable loading external plugins like rustyhook-kafka for additional event sources.

title: Second-level cron precision
description: Support 6-field cron expressions with second-level precision (e.g., '*/5 * * * * *' for every 5 seconds). Verify if current cron crate supports this or find alternative. Inspired by supercronic.

title: Platform-specific handler variants
description: Support platform-specific command variants in configuration. Allow different commands for Windows, Linux, and macOS within the same handler. Inspired by go-task platforms attribute.

title: Web UI and API
description: Add real-time handler status dashboard, execution history and logs, dynamic handler management, metrics and monitoring.

title: Event context and variables
description: Pass rich context between handlers and to shell commands. Support MESSAGE_ID, MESSAGE_BODY, and custom exports between handlers.
